intro: Oxydectes fallax, commonly known as the red-stemmed daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its vibrant yellow flowers surrounded by pale green ray florets. The plant typically grows in well-drained sandy soils and prefers full sun exposure. It produces a compact, bushy growth habit with reddish stems that become more pronounced as the plant matures. Oxydectes fallax is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a cut flower.
